thread.title: 10 Must-See Digital Health Startups of 2015

author: Health 2.0
title: 10 Must-See Digital Health Startups of 2015
text:
Ten digital health companies will demo their products for the first time during Launch! at Health 2.0 9th Annual Fall Conference in Santa Clara, CA on October 4-7. Health 2.0 will host the competition on Wednesday, October 7th. After the demos, the audience votes for their favorites. Previous Launch! winners have included Castlight Health, Basis, and OM*Signal. This year's finalists:
1. Bloom Technologies will debut their discrete, wireless wearable for expecting mothers to track contractions and other physiological changes in pregnancy to improve maternal and neonatal outcomes.
2. Flow Health a free network connecting consumers, providers and payers around shared patient data including Patient Check-In, an iPad app replacing the standard medical clipboard used by patients to complete forms at the doctor's office.
3. Sensentia a fully-automated inquiry system that is automating inefficient processes using natural language processing and more to empower patients to make better health care decisions.
4. PeerWell connects users via a mobile app with a team of peers working together to improve their mental health through cognitive behavioral therapy techniques.
5. Nurx the easiest and fastest way to obtain oral contraceptives, including prescriptions and drug delivery directly from a mobile app.
6. MedWand a revolutionary telemedicine device that allows providers to remotely perform physical examinations via secure Internet connections.
7. Doco.la a portal for physicians to create rich educational modules and share them with their patients.
8. Vivor helpings patient seek financial assistance through a matchmaking platform facilitated by a financial advisor.
9. Gliimpse collects and organizes a patient's entire health history, across vendors, health systems, and more, to create a streamlined health profile.
10. uncleCare a streamlined experience for patients who are under anticoagulant therapy allows them to easily transmit their data to a clinic and receive easy medication dosage updates, lifestyle reminders and more.
Traction is back for a second year featuring companies who are on the verge of raising Series A rounds of $2-$15M. See ten of the most promising startups compete for funding in front of leading venture capitalists, angel investors, government officials and entrepreneurs. Judges decide which company can scale the most quickly.
